render.tex: %text At a given time $t$, the position of a particle is given by $(x,y) = \left(t, \log t \right)$ This particle is accelerating along the $x-$axis%

reason.tex: %text The \underline\text{speed} of the particle \underline\text{along the $x-$axis} is given by \[\quad s_x = \frac{d}{dt} x = \frac{d}{dt} t = 1\] It's acceleration, however, is \[ \quad a_x = \frac{d}{dt} s_x = 0 \] Hence, the particle is \underline\text{not} accelerating along the $x-$axis. In fact, its speed (along $x-$axis) is constant%
